membership: The ETF is affiliated to the International Transport Workers' Federation, the European Trade Union Confederation and it is member of Eurocadres.
relevant_communication:
EU Funded Projects: 
- Assistance for the ATM social dialogue working group (Agreement nr VS/2015/0041) 
- TASCS - Towards a Sustainable Crewing System (VS/2017/0003) 
- Fair Aviation for All (VS/2016/0395) 
- Ground Handling Social Dialogue Support (VS/2015/0342) 
- The changing face of ports: socio-economic impact of market-based and technological developments on EU ports (VS/2017/0016) 
- Building the future of the road sector (VS/2016/0246) 
- Rail Mobile Workers (VS/2016/0403) 
- Towards true socially sustainable EU Fishery: the contribution of EU Social partners (VS/2015/0042) 
- Anticipating the impact of changes in transport on employment, working conditions, professions and skills (VS/2015/0226) 
- Inclusive and Fair Transport in Europe (VS/2015/0230) 
- Rail Mobile Workers – Assessment of the social partners of the implementation and application of the agreement on certain aspects of working conditions of mobile workers engaged in interoperable cross-border services in the railway sector (VS/2016/0403) 
- EASA Capacity building (VS/2017/0333) 
- For a Strong and more socially sustainable European maritime sector (VS/2017/0328) 
- Promotion of the toolbox for successful social dialogue in air traffic management (VS/2017/0364) 
- A socially sustainable Common Fisheries Policy: workers’ participation in the fisheries, aquaculture and processing sectors (VS/2017/0324)
goals__remit:
The ETF was founded in 1998 to defend transport and fisheries workers'interests at European level and to make representations on their behalf to EU bodies. 
 
The ETF represents more than 230 member organisations in 41 countries, for over 5 million members. 
 
The ETF is the European branch of the International Transport Workers' Federation (ITF) and the transport branch of the ETUC.  
 
The ETF is the European social partner that represents transport and fisheries workers in seven sectoral social dialogue committees: maritime transport, civil aviation, fisheries, railways, road, ports and inland waterways.
